info.name: Integration Development Guide
info.description:
This collection contains examples from the Integration Development Guide of Acumatica ERP.

**Testing the Requests**

To test the examples, you configure this collection and the Acumatica ERP instance to be used as follows:

 - Deploy a new Acumatica ERP instance with the U100 dataset. For details on deploying an instance, see [To Deploy an Acumatica ERP Instance](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=b18ad378-0a8c-44f1-a14c-6b4f9c6271e4) in the Installation Guide.
 - Specify the URL of the instance in the BaseURL variable of the collection. The EndpointURL variable uses the value from the BaseURL variable and specifies the URL of the Default/18.200.001 endpoint. You do not need to change this variable until you want to use another endpoint.
 - To sign in to the instance in the client application, use the tenant name (which you specified when you created the instance) and the HEADOFFICE branch.

item.name: Working with the Contract-Based REST API
Signing in to the Service

request.description: This example shows how to sign in to Acumatica ERP. This process is described in [Signing in to the Service](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=0322492a-de9b-4443-b256-923c48aff31d).

response.name: Signing in to the Service

item.name: Retrieval of User-Defined Fields

request.description:
This example illustrates the use of the $custom parameter, which is described in [Parameters for Retrieving Data](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=c5e2f36a-0971-4b33-b127-3c3fe14106ff).

To test this example, you need to add a user-defined field for the ORGSIZE attribute on the Sales Orders (SO301000) form and specify its value for the 000029 sales order.

For details about how to add a user-defined field, see [To Add User-Defined Fields to a Form](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=810b4857-2ffe-4764-aebf-4d657334f0be).

response.name: Retrieval of User-Defined Fields

item.name: Retrieval of the Schema of Custom Fields

request.description: This example shows the retrieval of the schema of custom fields, which is described in [Retrieval of the Schema of Custom Fields](https://help.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=64daacf1-75c4-4bfa-b57b-36222020e7c9).

response.name: Retrieval of the Schema of Custom Fields

item.name: Signing out from the Service

request.description: This example shows how to sign out from Acumatica ERP. This process is described in [Signing out from the Service](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=f6701ec1-2296-4155-8242-03d29006bf6e).

response.name: Signing out from the Service

item.name: Contract-Based API Examples
Inventory and Order Management
Creation of a Bill for Particular Lines of a Purchase Order

request.description: This example shows how to create an AP bill for a particular line of a purchase order in Acumatica ERP. This process is described in [Creation of a Bill for Particular Lines of a Purchase Order or Receipt](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=a1116acb-66aa-4415-8148-5bbab45b0a50).

response.name: Creation of a Bill for Particular Lines of a Purchase Order

item.name: Creation of a Bill for Particular Lines of a Purchase Receipt

request.description: This example shows how to create an AP bill for a particular line of a purchase receipt in Acumatica ERP. This process is described in [Creation of a Bill for Particular Lines of a Purchase Order or Receipt](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=a1116acb-66aa-4415-8148-5bbab45b0a50).

response.name: Creation of a Bill for Particular Lines of a Purchase Receipt

This process is described in [Creation of a General Ledger Transaction with a Project Code That Does Not Produce a Project Transaction](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=682496e3-6498-4855-b33d-a40dbf501b82).

item.name: Time Entry

request.description: This example shows how to specify the time spent on the tasks of projects. This process is described in [Time Entry](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=847b54c3-116e-47b1-89af-14a19cc5855a).

response.name: Time Entry

item.name: Search for Time Entry

query.value: cf.DateTime(f='Items.Date') ge datetimeoffset'2019-08-17' and cf.DateTime(f='Items.Date') le datetimeoffset'2019-08-18T23%3A59%3A59.999%2B04%3A00'

request.description: This example shows how to search for the time entries entered on particular date. This process is described in [Search for Time Entries by Date](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=c7576634-c730-42fd-9cc7-03aa85164bb9).

response.name: Search for Time Entry

query.value: cf.DateTime(f='Items.Date') ge datetimeoffset'2019-08-17' and cf.DateTime(f='Items.Date') le datetimeoffset'2019-08-18T23%3A59%3A59.999%2B04%3A00'

item.name: Customer Relationship Management

This folder contains examples from the [Contract-Based API Examples](https://help-2019r2.acumatica.com/Help?ScreenId=ShowWiki&pageid=bbb8b84b-07d7-4a69-adf8-33dc5d430b60) chapter of the Integration Development Guide.
